AF058C3F7472493AAF6E6636F0F39531.description: Explain how exchange rates affect the purchasing power of consumers.

B2B2B2B1AAED4D459CCE89B1224E61A8.description: Define trade barriers (e.g., tariff, quota) including the difference between balance of trade and balance of payments, explaining why countries sometimes erect barriers to trade, how such barriers affect a country’s economic growth, and assessing arguments for and against free trade.

9049D102F3A14C12B8394F0DE9762F20.description: Define and distinguish between absolute and comparative advantage and explain how most trade occurs because of a comparative advantage in the production of a particular good or service.

1BB8A01FB86C48A1BFEDC319487CF642.description: Explain the consequences of trade among individuals, regions, and countries by describing that all forms of trade can ultimately be explained as voluntary exchange between individuals.

CC827493D96C4946B2880CBE540A706E.description: The student will analyze how trade affects the economies of the world.

169760F9C06E4DE9AFAC34439CCC3CE1.description: Analyze how the Federal Reserve attempts to effectuate price stability, full employment, and economic growth via monetary tools (e.g., changes in the discount rate, reserve requirements, and the money supply).

CCFC695B853A456F986B2F1C347C9E8B.description: Describe the organization and functions of the Federal Reserve System, including its congressional mandates (i.e., maximize employment and control inflation) and its expansion to provide financial stability.

5E694288831643E0A654D37277721714.description: Explain how changes in federal spending and taxation can affect budget deficits, surpluses, and the national debt.

CD33AD408A444492A84F5AD83864A0C8.description: Compare fiscal and monetary policy and evaluate the impact each has on the economy.

5C9218A3FD4F47C69733817E3A228C6C.description: Analyze the costs and benefits of government policies on economic growth and prosperity, including how political and social goals are sometimes pursued through economic decisions.

4275D8009BB043CFB5BF42F7C4BA2B30.description: Define progressive, proportional, and regressive taxation and explain the effects of each on earners.

0CF50A2F733C41978EA227D8C5AE4E6A.description: The student will identify the potential economic impact of government policy.

36076820CF394713B9C4240F3815FAA0.description: Evaluate the impact of self-interest, competition, collusion, technological advancement, standard of living, the business cycle, and fluctuation on the GDP.

7AEBC84525184242805AB690AE7C726A.description: Describe the impact on the economy when GDP and GNP are growing versus declining.

A43846FE03CC4C86962DBF7D6B7E5FDC.description: Examine the differences between the nominal and the real GDP (Gross Domestic Product) and explain how GDP and GNP (Gross National Product) are used to describe economic output over time by comparing the GDP of various nations representative of market, command, and mixed economic systems.

C2E612B1C6104C5780FECF5FDCF8057C.description: The student will identify the basic measures of a nation’s economic output and income.

707599E654E64DC5950CBF48318DD771.description: Describe the causes and different types of unemployment, how unemployment is measured, and the impact of unemployment on different sectors of the United States economy.

06EDB65A8CAB44E48E210F8B078437F4.description: Explain that prices are signals of relative scarcity and that attempts to control prices may lead to subsequent distortions in supply and demand.

13AE6D78B0DB4BF093ACDFD789F0F416.description: Explain how economic conditions, including supply and demand, have an impact on consumers, producers, and government policymakers.

DF2B25DB8C5D4D938E8CD25F39C0275A.description: Describe how current economic conditions can be affected by many factors (e.g., unemployment, Consumer Price Index (CPI), individual savings and debt, government debt, government-enforced price ceilings, labor supply, and inflation).

5BB5C3048B9E4D53BD06EFF9AFB0D704.description: The student will examine the impact of the global economy on domestic conditions within the United States economy.

F942DDDFC5E945DC94E761803C9D560F.description: Evaluate the costs and benefits of incorporation including the expansion of resources and reduction of risks.

BC0FC306BC9C46D7A2288314E0A04C43.description: Analyze the potential risks and gains to entrepreneurs establishing new businesses or inventing a new product.

0FFFE720D4D84500BAC80AC438CA94A4.description: Explain the function of profit in a market economy as an incentive/reward for entrepreneurs’ acceptance of risk.

FF07DC18C2844363BFC79A198ECB5952.description: Describe how decisions made by an entrepreneur and a laborer affect job opportunities for others (e.g., profit-maximizing level of output, hiring the optimal number of workers, comparing marginal costs and benefits of producing more or less of a resource).

E081EFB74ADC4A4FBCBB4BFEDF8190A7.description: Evaluate the role of labor and explain the importance of workers to production, including their relationship to entrepreneurs by describing how the earnings of workers are determined by the value of the product/service produced and the workers’ productivity.

64CB2CD8880C4721870C9CA94416C9E8.description: The student will analyze the role of entrepreneurs and laborers within a market economy.

FE4C4C7A15414828864A6597E631A1B0.description: Determine how changes in real interest rates impact people’s decisions to borrow money and purchase goods in a market economy.

042C01F3A9FD47A1ACFC8799A7A8452D.description: Analyze the relationship between interest rates and inflation rates to both the borrower and the lender

8D83CF0B76E14F8FA4BFFD3FD2D3FB43.description: The student will evaluate how interest rates impact decisions in the market economy.

73BBAADAC11B4B75B9A749B5770BBF89.description: Define inflation and determine how it is measured, including the impact inflation has on different sectors of the United States economy.

1AFAC89D78874318AC5CCE782259DD2F.description: Identify the characteristics (e.g., divisibility, durability, acceptability, scarcity, portability) and functions (e.g., store of value, unit of account, and medium of exchange) of money.

FB1586570BEF4AC3A7C6B7207D48A74E.description: Explain how individuals, businesses, and the overall economy benefits from the various uses of money (e.g., trading, borrowing, investing, and diversifying) versus saving money.

54D6F3F7F08B4A64AF56CB86A07A1810.description: Explain the emergence and the basic functions of money (e.g., medium of exchange, store of value, unit of account).

C3068F8E74354792916AC52C0E72F7A9.description: The student will examine the function and uses of money within the modern economy, including trading, borrowing, and investing.

D86AC8E8698247649437F18326A6C92D.description: Describe how financial institutions, such as banks and credit unions, allow people to pool their incomes and provide future income through investment in stocks.

82C4BA83CCAE4E46916EA9F4894878D6.description: Describe the purpose, costs, and benefits of government funded services.

25C0D04B2FBE44218BC7498C9A8BF960.description: Evaluate the impact of the government's protection of private property rights and enforcement of the rule of law in a market economy.

86E1FAC877EA4D1C918D06C975F4D803.description: The student will describe the role of economic institutions and government in a market economy.

2198061175AD4D92817BA49A4E157317.description: Explain how people’s own self-interest, incentives, and disincentives influence market decisions.

F0736C2B28F74917B59D14AE90F13F9E.description: Explain how competition among many sellers lowers costs and prices and encourages producers to produce more.

D9985A47A9784DF1A3D38EAC8BE7DB9C.description: Evaluate the role of the government within the economy as it relates to defining, establishing, and enforcing property rights.

086F1D1DD4B6445DB64B5B90729A3DF7.description: Compare the basic characteristics of monopoly, oligopoly, pure competition, and market process.

E77E3EF562564227B14943A6CF6E22B4.description: Explain ways that firms engage in competition and examine the role of firms in setting prices in a market economy, including administered price theory and the impact of marketing.

460DCACCA80449FA836FF0A2FC01EDD0.description: Explain what causes shortages and surpluses (e.g., government-imposed price floors, price ceilings, and other government regulations) and describe their impact on prices and people’s decisions to buy or sell.

1B4786654B374ABA869512B2A78111F7.description: Analyze how price and non-price factors affect the demand and supply of goods and services available in the marketplace.

618E4099101648378A60942F22E979BF.description: The student will explain how prices are set in a market economy and will determine how price provides incentives to buyers and sellers.

050616A54BCD4A40ACD80C417343B90E.description: Describe how clearly defined and enforced property rights are essential to a market economy.

981C4D352ED1420CA1913202155C6687.description: Describe the impact of comparative and absolute advantage upon the three basic economic questions: What goods and services to produce? How to produce them? For whom are they produced?

AE51E5BEE0A441768333453CEF52F8B3.description: Compare the world’s basic economic systems of traditional, market (free enterprise), command, and mixed market economies; identify how these systems attempt to meet the needs of their societies.

3A6EDDB4F42745E99CD69F4D7DA96E03.description: The student will evaluate how societies answer basic economic questions.

A5E7A9F0A2D64028981757B024F2859C.description: Explain how voluntary exchange occurs only when all participating parties expect to benefit with each transaction contributing to overall societal well-being.

75A6493B49824BC4BE6E6B14E9347A69.description: Describe how people respond predictably to positive and negative incentives and how individual choices based on personal subjective preferences cannot be predicted.

06DDC2F51B6B41488D7BA177272B6F07.description: Examine how producers and consumers confront the condition of scarcity by making choices that involve opportunity costs and tradeoffs.

8FFF85F978444F9D92C99F0740C9187F.description: Explain how productive resources (natural, human, capital) are necessary for the production of goods and services.

1FB5C21FCC564EBDB2295C568F7A95FA.description: Determine appropriate courses of economic actions using a variety of economic reasoning and decision-making models.

A15639EE9BD64512BA6DAC3B8BDE7B40.description: Define and explain basic economic concepts (e.g., scarcity, surplus, opportunity cost, cost/benefit analysis, risk/reward relationship, incentive, and trade-off) applying them to a variety of economic situations.

5F107F3DBDE248F9AD44ABBD2D66F9C0.description: The student will develop and apply economic reasoning and decision-making skills.

501DAF321D4447079704BD6938B5AC50.description: Construct presentations or products for a designated audience, using research and reasoning to enhance understanding of a topic or issue.

4441CE3F649841EDAFA55145F3F0FFE2.description: Integrate quotes and summaries of research findings into written products while avoiding plagiarism.

8B4B10AEC3734999B13265182D486820.description: Develop self-generated theses or claims related to independent research and investigations using credible and relevant sources.

447B8ABD254B43ACA1DC8053C3EA0C05.description: Engage in authentic research to acquire, refine, and share knowledge through written presentations and products.

C5AF012F70F54A808F32DF5BC342032A.description: Compose argumentative written products, including a precise claim as distinguished from opposing claims, organizing logical reasoning, and providing credible evidence to develop an argument.

FB5C2067891747C7B8F37BE966F7F39A.description: Compose informative essays and written products, developing a thesis, citing and incorporating evidence from multiple sources and maintaining an organized, formal structure.

B7992E4E76474ABE81ACEB4EF4A3495A.description: Summarize and paraphrase, integrate evidence, and cite sources to create written products, research projects, and presentations for multiple purposes related to social studies content.

EF0A50E902044199B2D025BE9C9B608E.description: The student will develop a variety of evidence- based written products designed for multiple purposes.

C7A1424655974678BDBAA7E289A7C4BE.description: Actively listen, evaluate, and analyze a speaker’s message, asking questions while engaged in collaborative discussions about social studies topics and texts.

883B5ADC83CB493F9C9C15ADF5BDBFDB.description: Evaluate the author’s point of view, potential bias, and how authors can reach different conclusions regarding the same issue.

5EFC2A6A739B4A83B370B38687AEA902.description: Evaluate the extent to which historical or cultural perspectives affect an author’s stated or implied purpose.

CC342EED021E43CE9FD42FF2C06FEB2E.description: Apply critical reading and thinking skills to interpret, evaluate, and respond to a variety of complex texts and perspectives.

60874E68DD3F4ED8A78DA60BBAFD69E5.description: Analyze information from visual, oral, digital, and interactive texts (e.g., maps, charts, images, political cartoons, videos, artwork) in order to draw conclusions and defend arguments.

7A50020E47D444479C5A40BFD22C60D2.description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources, evaluating features such as author, date, and origin of information.

A83248FE7F12487282C752BAB5A0763A.description: Comprehend, evaluate, and synthesize textual sources to acquire and refine knowledge in the social studies.

B219982EF4AD49298C2E085DDA189340.description: The student will engage in critical, active reading of primary and secondary sources related to social studies concepts.

36B5FF40E3C443B791657AB1D47F9342.description: Evaluate the impact, both intended and unintended, of government policies on market outcomes at national and global levels, past and present.

92B35073FC574A48BDA475516BD99FEA.description: Construct arguments using a combination of evidence regarding solutions used by nations to address historical or contemporary economic issues.

2EA3FDDBDC9041DB85760626AE5107A4.description: Evaluate economic data from charts and graphs, noting trends and making predictions.

E10040758C0141E39486422D17DAFA2D.description: Identify the principles of economic systems and develop an understanding of the benefits of a market system in local, national, and global settings.

5A8C4F38D96E483AB4BCEE0CC134BC3E.description: Evaluate the extent to which political and economic decisions have had significant impact on human and physical environments of various places and regions.

5BF1941832DE43C6B383C6CF960D5F87.description: Compare and analyze complex maps and mapping technologies to analyze spatial patterns of human and physical environments, explaining relationships between the environment and events, past and present.

1C163B3E19E7428798B488B23C3CEA00.description: Actively engage in asking and answering geographic questions by acquiring, organizing, and analyzing multiple sources of data and information about the world’s past and present.

198C84FD0F3A438E97F73E0C2394701D.description: Demonstrate a mastery of geographic concepts and the use of geographic tools to understand the impact of geography on the past and present.

F1CA8816FC8E4D65A21D280AE2DEAB23.description: Evaluate how multiple, complex events are shaped by unique circumstances of time and place; construct and interpret parallel timelines.

7DACF5FA44024203BB21EC6C79A7574B.description: Analyze complex and interacting factors that influence multiple perspectives during different historical eras and contemporary events.

0765727BDAC94012A5064D021BA67E9C.description: Gather and evaluate the usefulness of various formats of evidence for specific inquiry, analyzing the broader historical context, and assessing potential bias and credibility of sources.

2D9B2B918C1545FB9F65813B2A709C18.description: Develop skills which demonstrate an understanding of historical events and the people who shaped our history.

6F9A5F4A5C4C4FA7B1A95CCA28D473C8.description: Analyze the impact of constitutions, laws, treaties, and international agreements, by comparing how various governmental powers and responsibilities have changed over time.

596C2A85DF7940C4ADE0D26C0F0940EB.description: Evaluate the impact of the structure and powers exercised by governmental systems on public policy, using historical and contemporary examples.

3ED260E99DF94ED893D8D190D534CB1D.description: Evaluate various significant documents from the United States and other nations to compare civic virtues and principles of political systems.

ADE6453B50574AF7A5A184C4B5D233F9.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the principles of government, the benefits of democratic systems, and their responsibilities as citizens.

ECE4C26A53A6477EA3BE2B677F3B97FF.description: The student will use interdisciplinary tools to acquire, apply, and evaluate content understanding of the four strands of social studies.

ED0F480730444C55B32E184E152FDCD1.description: Demonstrate understanding of content through the development of self-driven inquiries and the completion of multi-staged, authentic tasks and assessments.

A3B79C4F85DC4DE2B31DA7FA0F5568EA.description: Reinforce critical thinking by evaluating and challenging ideas and assumptions, analyzing and explaining inconsistencies in reasoning.

C83089804AD04E269D2E005FDD1AFAC2.description: Evaluate points of agreement and disagreement from reliable information and expert interpretations used to answer supporting questions related to content knowledge.

D6E93D37114D4CEABB1C3E7EC746D9C4.description: Develop, investigate, and evaluate plausible answers to essential questions that reflect enduring understandings across time, real world circumstances, and social studies disciplines.

D6F75431D59241E3878E325249973F60.description: Develop practices which demonstrate an understanding that social studies involves the evaluation of evidence.

881D85DB74B74DB08B45F5A31D254EC9.description: Gather and evaluate information regarding complex problems, assessing individual and collective actions taken to address them.

009BBB07713647EDA5B63E606D98BE23.description: Engage in a range of deliberative and democratic processes to develop strategies to address authentic, real-world problems in community and out-of-school contexts.

FC2587CED98D48BEAF7FD1ADCDBB4E19.description: Evaluate the impact of perspectives, civil discourse, and democratic principles on addressing civic issues.

971A36EF8D774F5E8AD2BED33C4C04ED.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the virtue of civil discourse to analyze and address real- world problems.

14A432D6B0884E8A9C35B5D9E4567112.description: The student will apply critical thinking skills to address authentic civic issues.
